projects.title: Stride Career Fair
projects.description: I developed a website for a design-centric career fair hosted by Design at UCSD.
projects.summary:
As part of Design at UCSDâ€™s leadership board, I worked alongside my cross-functional team to put together UC San Diegoâ€™s first design-centric career fair. Stride follows a unique career fair format that allows design students to better showcase their work and portfolios.

In collaboration with one of our visual designers, I developed the event website. I also assisted our graphic studio in creating visual collateral.

projects.title: Design at UCSD
projects.description: I am visual + brand designer, web developer, and student leader at the largest pre-professional design community on campus.
projects.summary: Since November 2017, Iâ€™ve been a student leader at the undergraduate design community Design at UCSD. I served as a visual and brand designer up until June 2018, where I designed marketing collateral, co-lead visual design workshops, and evolved brand identity. I now spearhead all our web development projects as our web developer.

details.title: Roles
details.content:
Visual and Brand Designer (Nov 2017 â€“ June 2018)
Web Developer (June 2018 â€“ Present)

blocks.title: Our Mission
blocks.content: To establish an open community of aspiring designers, to inspire creative confidence, and to ease students into industry.

blocks.title: Web Projects
blocks.captionBefore: As our web developer, I collaborate with our visual design team to create websites for events, workshops, and email campaigns. Two of the biggest projects I've worked on so far are Stride Career Fair and Design Frontiers: Intuit.

blocks.title: Soft Rebrand
blocks.content:
During my term as a visual and brand designer, my co and I introduced a new, illustration-heavy creative direction that refreshed the face of Design at UCSD.

Problem

While crafting graphics for the org, we quickly noted a few flaws in our visual system that inspired us to rethink the branding guidelines surrounding our marketing visuals. The existing system for creating event banners involved placing color overlays over photos, with each color representing a different event type:

  • Yellow â€” industry events
  • Red â€” social events
  • Green â€” design skill workshops
  • Blue â€” data + research workshops

blocks.captionAfter:
Major issues we ran into included:

  • Visual style was outdated and limited creativity. Design at UCSD is a community of young, eager designers, and we wanted a fun and contemporary look to reflect this.
  • Our event type distribution was too unbalanced to justify using a color-based system. Over the course of the 2017â€“2018 school year, Design at UCSD held 13 design skill workshops, 9 social events, 6 industry events, and only 1 data + research workshop.
  • Banners were not unique to each event. Social media is fast-paced, and more interest could be generated by using eye-catching visuals.

blocks.captionBefore:
Solution

To reflect current design trends and craft a unique identity for each event, we decided to retire the color-based system and start creating dedicated illustrations for each banner. We used a flat design style and incorporated derivations of our original 4 colors to stay on-brand.
blocks.captionAfter: Shout-out to Nancy, Lauren, and Lucy.

blocks.alt: Side-by-side comparison of a Facebook event from Jan 2018 and the same event from Jan 2019, showing an increase in interest
blocks.captionBefore: Our soft rebrand was received positively by our leadership board and Design at UCSD saw an increase in online member engagement.

projects.title: Burow
projects.summary: Burow is a desktop web app that helps users find the perfect new home to move to. With a focus on price, walkability, and school rating, users can easily pinpoint neighborhoods within their target cities that suit their needs.

details.title: Key Roles
details.content: Led the design and development of the landing page and co-led the brand design. UX was done as a team.

details.title: Key Skills
details.content: Prototyping, brand design, web design, web development (HTML, CSS, Sass, React)

details.title: Teammates
